author: Melanie Grayce West
title: City Rolls Out Alert System for Hit-And-Run Accidents
text:
New York Cityâ€™s new hit-and-run alert system, modeled after Amber alert notifications, went into effect this weekend, a new step in helping police to identify drivers involved in deadly incidents.
The system is designed to provide rapid information to the public when a hit-and-run accident results in serious injury or death. The alerts are to go out from the New York Police Department within 12 hours of an incident, via social media, email, text, phone or media broadcasts, and include vehicle and any other information available.
